alert.note: Alert for Delaware (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 01 at 2:03AM EDT until April 01 at 2:30AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN DELAWARE COUNTY... At 202 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Radnor, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Delaware, Ashley, Radnor, Ostrander, Warrensburg, Delaware State Park, Leonardsburg, Kilbourne, State Route 257 at US Route 36 and State Route 229 at US Route 23. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
